quest.name: Litany of Peace
journal: Ser Aymeric relates a small part of his and Estinien's shared history, and muses on the brotherly bond which has formed between Alphinaud and the gruff dragoon. His thoughts are interrupted, however, by the sudden arrival of a messenger who urges the lord commander to visit the infirmary immediately. Trouble Ser Aymeric for news of your ailing comrade's condition.

Having followed Ser Aymeric to the infirmary, you are relieved to find Estinien in full possession of his senses and already mocking the openly weeping Alphinaud. You sense, however, that he is a changed man. Having spoken of his spirit's enslavement by Nidhogg, he declares at last that he intends to surrender the mantle of Azure Dragoon, his hunt now at an end.

Echoing Estinien's resolve, Ser Aymeric finally moves to abolish the thousand-year rule of the archbishops, paving the way for a new republic. In the days that follow, Ishgard's governance is placed in the hands of a newly formed House of Commons and House of Lords. And though Ser Aymeric would like nothing more than to lay down the reins of state, he soon finds himself elected to the highest seat in the latter.

You, meanwhile, borrow Midgardsormr's wings to escort Hraesvelgr back to Zenith, and find the former lord commander waiting to greet you upon your return. Speak with Ser Aymeric at the airship landing.

Ser Aymeric is clearly burdened by his new position, but is quick to stifle his complaints, vowing to lead Ishgard into a new era of peace─one measured step at a time. He then reveals that Estinien has disappeared, and asks that you give him a message should your paths ever chance to cross. Finally, Ser Aymeric bids you convey his warmest regards to Alphinaud. Return to Fortemps Manor, and seek him out.

Alphinaud appears certain that Ser Aymeric will make good on his promise to lead the people of Ishgard safely along their chosen road, though the way be choked with the debris of history. The Scions, too, have a difficult path ahead of them─bringing about a new dawn will be no easy task in the shadow of Ascian plots and implacable primals. But as the final strains of the Dragonsong War drift gently heavensward and a newborn litany of peace swells to take its place, it cannot be denied that there is much to celebrate.
objectives: Speak with Alphinaud at Fortemps Manor.

dialogue.name: AYMERIC
dialogue.text: My own friendship with Estinien began some ten years past, shortly after we joined the Temple Knights...

dialogue.name: AYMERIC
dialogue.text: I learned his name soon enough, but Estinien barely registered my existence. I was less a fellow recruit, and more a shadow which occasionally darkened his path.

dialogue.name: AYMERIC
dialogue.text: And so I might have remained, had fate not seen fit to intervene. While out on patrol, our company was set upon by a dragon, and we were the only two to survive. The experience forged a bond between us, as such life-threatening situations are wont to do.

dialogue.name: AYMERIC
dialogue.text: Despite our friendship, he remained an intense and solitary youth, wholly obsessed with claiming vengeance against Nidhogg. Revenge was ever at the forefront of his mind─revenge for the death of his parents, and revenge for his younger brother.

dialogue.name: AYMERIC
dialogue.text: I would venture that in Alphinaud he sees something of his lost sibling.

dialogue.name: AYMERIC
dialogue.text: And in the ungentle chidings of Estinien, Alphinaud has found the elder brother he never had.

dialogue.name: AYMERIC
dialogue.text: Truth be told, Estinien's tactless observations have saved me from disaster more than once, and I can well understand Alphinaud's affection for him. He is a friend for whom I would gladly─

dialogue.name: TEMPLEKNIGHT02247
dialogue.text: Lord Commander! Your presence is required in the infirmary!

dialogue.name: AYMERIC
dialogue.text: Is he─ Tell them I am on my way!

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: <sigh> So it is over, then...

dialogue.name: TEMPLEKNIGHT02247
dialogue.text: Captain Whitecape ordered me to fetch Ser Aymeric with all haste. I know no more than that.

dialogue.name: HANDELOUP
dialogue.text: I did not take the Azure Dragoon for a man to pass in his bed...

dialogue.name: AYMERIC
dialogue.text: Quickly, Forename! We must go to him!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Upon proceeding to the infirmary, several cutscenes will play in sequence.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: It is recommended that you set aside sufficient time to view these scenes in their entirety.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: Proceed to the infirmary?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: AYMERIC
dialogue.text: I was gazing out at the Sea of Clouds, in an all too rare moment of idleness, when I chanced to behold a certain hero wending herhis way towards the city on dragonback. Welcome home, Forename.

dialogue.name: AYMERIC
dialogue.text: Nay, 'twas no grave matter that moved me to greet you in person. Between you and me, I merely sought respite from the pressures of office... No sooner do I surrender my role as temporary head of state than I am burdened with a position of more permanent responsibility!

dialogue.name: AYMERIC
dialogue.text: I fancy that it echoes in some small measure the way you must feel when your improbable feats of heroism are rewarded with still more impossible challenges...

dialogue.name: AYMERIC
dialogue.text: The myth which guided our society for generations lies in tatters─am I then to be scorned for building upon the system of nobility that I once sought to tear down? And what strange jest is this that places me at its pinnacle? An archbishop's bastard at the head of the House of Lords...

dialogue.name: AYMERIC
dialogue.text: ...Ah, but these questions are for me to answer.

dialogue.name: AYMERIC
dialogue.text: It is not in man's nature to change overnight. This I learned through painful experience. And it was this hard lesson which convinced me to take the path which we now follow. Even as we rebuild the bridge between man and dragon, so must we reimagine Ishgard─one carefully placed stone at a time.

dialogue.name: AYMERIC
dialogue.text: We must remember that it is not for us that we lay this groundwork, but for the men and women that our children will become. May their towers rise proudly from the fundament of our legacy.

dialogue.name: AYMERIC
dialogue.text: ...I hear word from Captain Whitecape that Estinien has vanished from his sickroom. His willfulness survives undiminished.

dialogue.name: AYMERIC
dialogue.text: Should you ever happen upon our unmannerly friend on your travels, pray assure him that I shall keep Ishgard safe until he deigns to come home.

dialogue.name: AYMERIC
dialogue.text: Thank you, Forename. And please, convey my warmest regards to Master Alphinaud.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text:
You've saved the day again, Forename!
...Not that I ever doubted you would!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: You spoke with Ser Aymeric? I do not envy him his new position.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Ishgard has chosen a new road, but one littered with the detritus of a thousand years of broken faith.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Yet though her people may stumble from time to time, I know of none better than Ser Aymeric to lead the march of progress.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: As for us, there remains the small matter of ushering in a new dawn in the shadow of inscrutable Ascian machinations and a seemingly endless procession of primals... But we too must walk our chosen path─no matter how treacherous the footing!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In the wake of Ishgard's governmental reform, new airship routes have been sanctioned. You may now travel to a selection of distant locales from the landing in Ishgard.

dialogue.name: WARRIOROFDARKNESS
dialogue.text: Thank you, Blanhaerz. Nay, you need not remain there. We shall rendezvous at the usual place.

dialogue.name: ELIDIBUS
dialogue.text: All is proceeding as expected, then?

dialogue.name: WARRIOROFDARKNESS
dialogue.text: Aye, there is naught to concern us. Aside from one overly curious mouse...

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: This way!

dialogue.name: WARRIOROFDARKNESS
dialogue.text: Him again...

dialogue.name: ELIDIBUS
dialogue.text: It is of no moment. They will play their part, and we will play ours...
